thread.title: Ground News - 'Lives at risk': Stonemason says world-first engineered stone ban will save lives
thread.title_full: Ground News - 'Lives at risk': Stonemason says world-first engineered stone ban will save lives

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - 'Lives at risk': Stonemason says world-first engineered stone ban will save lives
text:
Summary by Ground News Construction, Forestry, Maritime Employees Union (CFMEU) hailed the full ban on engineered stone as a life-saving decision. Federal, state and territory ministers announced on 13 December that the deadly product will be banned from 1 July 2024. CFMEU National Secretary Zach Smith said Australia would be a safer place when the ban is implemented. Share menu More
Filters 2 Articles 2 Articles All Left Center Right
ABC Australia Lean Left High Factuality Government: Australian Government 'Lives at risk': Stonemason says world-first engineered stone ban will save lives The production of engineered stone will be banned in most Australian states and territories by mid-2024. Perth stonemason John Santoro says it should've happened years ago.
